22.title: Thunderbolt

notes: SUMMARY: The orphaned son of Americans in Tibet, Peter Cannon is raised and trained in a lamasery, then moves to the U.S. Acting by telepathy through a gangster, Tibetan miscreant The Hooded One soon causes a dinosaur rampage in New York City, and Cannon dons a costume to save the day. notes: Summary: At a bar with Hi, Thirsty talks about leaving his job.

156.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
156.title: "I Wanted Her To See What Our Lawn Could Look Like If She Really Worked At It!"
156.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Irma Thurston is joining Hi and Thirsty on the golf course today.

157.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
157.title: "It's All in the Grip!"
157.author: Dik Browne
157.appears_in: reprinted on p. 152 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty explains his confidence at golf: the handle of his club is a flask of liquor.

158.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
158.title: "It's Usually Not Until Mid-July That I Lose Sight of Thirsty"
158.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: It's been a good year for growing grass; Thirsty is sleeping in his back yard.

159.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
159.title: "My Prayer Book"
159.author: Dik Browne
159.appears_in: reprinted on p. 152 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty has found his ball in the woods, and Hi offers to toss him what he needs from his golf bag.

160.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
160.title: "Or Else Mr. Thurston Next Door is Cooking Outside Again"
160.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie sees the sky darkening, and thinks it might rain.

161.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
161.title: "Somehow He Manages to Hiccup in the Middle of Every Backswing"
161.author: Dik Browne
161.appears_in: reprinted on p. 153 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty's timing is off, but Ditto's isn't.

162.heading: Thurston, Thirsty.
162.title: "We Better Play Again Tomorrow"
162.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi and Thirsty see a snowflake on the golf course.

163.heading: Thurston's Den.
163.title: "'Til Then, It's 'Thurston's Den'"
163.author: Chance Brown.
notes: Summary: Thirsty and Hi dream about playing at Pebble Beach, St. Andrews, Harbor Town or Augusta National.

169.author: [No author]

First published as daily newspaper strips from 8/9/37 to 2/5/38. 1. Funny animal comics. I. Gottfredson, Floyd. II. Osborne, Ted. III. Maris, Merrill de. IV. Taliaferro, Al. V. Thwaits, Ted. VI. The Monarch of Medioka. VII. Series. Call no.: PN6728.M46M57 1990

170.heading: Thwaites, Ted.
170.title: "The Monarch of Medioka, pt. 4"
170.author: plot & pencils, Floyd Gottfredson ; written by Ted Osborne and Merrill de Maris ; inked by Al Taliaferro and Ted Thwaites
170.appears_in: 16 p. in Walt Disney's Comics & Stories, no. 596 (Apr. 1995); originally syndicated Aug. 9, 1937 to Feb. 5, 1938.
notes: SUMMARY: Mickey cuts taxes and starts and economic revival, but now he has to marry Phylline; meanwhile Minnie and Duke Varlott are each trying to capture the real king, who's living it up as a "mystery playboy" on the Continent. I. [Each creator] II. Mickey Mouse. k. Tax cuts. k. Economic revivals. k. Revivals. k. Marriage. k. Minnie Mouse. k. Varlott, Duke. k. Kings. k. Living it up. k. Mystery playboys. k. Playboys. k. The Continent. Call no.: PN6728.1.D4W3no.596
